attributes.action: Set up screening programme for adult scoliosis patients for respiratory problems
attributes.background: Severe scoliosis can cause breathing problems and respiratory failure. Some scoliosis patients have been unexpectedly told they need oxygen and ventilators and may be in respiratory failure before they are treated.
attributes.additional_details: If lung function tests and sleep studies were carried out on these patients annually, the signs of respiratory failure would be picked up earlier, and they would be able to receive other forms of treatment such as pulmonary rehab and inhalers, rather than going straight on to oxygen and ventilators.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all care homes and nursing homes to install cameras/cctv
attributes.background:
There have been a number of criminal cases following allegations of physical, emotional and other abuse of vulnerable residents in care and nursing homes. 
These residents often have illnesses such as dementia, Alzheimer's disease and cannot report abuse themselves. They need protection not abuse.

attributes.action: Enable ILR for Tier 2 Established Staff Visa holders
attributes.background: As per the current rules, Tier 2 ICT Visa holders, which was issued before April 2010, are eligible for ILR. In April 2010, rules were changed, and Tier 2 ICT Visa was given with the name as Established-Staff until April 2011. This Visa can be extended any number of times but not eligible for ILR.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is for enabling ILR after completion of 5 years for Established-staff category Visa holders. Visa holders stay in the country for more than 6 years, but not eligible for ILR under 5-year route. The number of Visas issued between April 2010 and 2011 is much less and few people are remaining in the country right now. So, please enable ILR for Established staff category Visa holders under 5-year rule.

attributes.action: Require all Blue Badge parking to be free
attributes.background: More & more frequently we are finding that Blue Badge parking is being charged at normal tariffs.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badge holders are the most severely disabled of all with life limiting or terminal diagnosis. 

Holders are restricted to the work they can do and are therefore limited to what they can potentially earn. 
 
Holders generally have increased expenses and are therefore more frugal with the funds available to them that non-disabled persons do not have.

Blue Badge Holders generally have to attend appointments at hospital/s at a greater frequency which also limits ability to earn whilst adding pressures to their earnings.

attributes.action: Give Support workers right to eat their own food in cafes etc
attributes.background: I work as a Support Worker with people with learning disabilities. I love to take them to places to eat out I cannot afford to eat with them. I’d like to be able if possible to eat my pack lunch while they enjoy their meal.
attributes.additional_details: I'd like to see all places where people can eat be required to allow support workers and carers who are supporting a person to eat at their establishments to be able to eat their own food should they wish to do so.

attributes.action: Increase the plastic packaging recycling&recovery target from 57% to 80% by 2020
attributes.background:
The Packaging Producer Responsibility Regulations framework is a positive step but targets do not reflect the urgency of our global plastic pollution crisis: producer target is 57% recycled or recovered by 2020. This is not enough.

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/packaging-producer-responsibilities
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is launching over Christmas 2018 where it still remains a challenge to participate in the gift giving tradition while avoiding single use plastics. 
Consumers need plastic free alternatives.
Excess plastic packaging engulfs our children's toys. 
Toy producers must be pressured to make urgent & significant changes necessary to protect our natural world.
The cheap price of plastic does not reflect the environmental cost. 
Producers profit whilst contributing to plastic pollution.

attributes.action: Patient transport and emergency vehicles, at all times, be allowed in bus lanes
attributes.background: Buses , taxis for profit and cycles are allowed in bus lanes. Patient transport ambulances sit in traffic so are late for essential appointments such as dialysis. Front line emergency crews waste time that could be spent responding while buses, taxis and cycles use bus lanes for convenience.
attributes.additional_details: Drive through Oxford, Reading or London for any evidence you wish to gather.

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to 15% when the UK leaves the EU to attract investment
attributes.background:
Once we leave the EU, the UK should reduce corporation tax to 15% This would do the following: 
-Attract new investment from multinational companies 
-Will stop companies leaving the UK due to Brexit 
-Allows companies to invest more money back into the country
-Reduce the unemployment rate

attributes.action: Change the law to end Clearance Fee charges for imported goods.
attributes.background: When ordering items from abroad we have to face a clearance fee of up to £12 on any item we import that have VAT applied by customs. This is excessive. Consumers are being shortchanged to be delivered what is rightfully theirs.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should legislate to end this practice.

attributes.action: Make CCTV mandatory in car parks
attributes.background:
Have you ever returned to your parked car and found it damaged by another vehicle? 

If the driver of the other vehicle doesn’t leave a note, they are committing a hit and run offence.

But without CCVT, the chances of catching them are slim and YOU are forced to foot the bill!
attributes.additional_details:
I use NCP assuming it’s the safest place to park. Turns out they don’t have CCTV! My car has been damaged by another vehicle and the driver didn’t leave a note, so I have to foot the bill. It’s nearly Christmas and I have a baby. Somebody else’s cowardly actions mean I have to pay a high excess to claim on insurance and lose my no claims bonus, or pay out more for private repairs.

If you’re sick of paying for others’ crimes, please sign my petition to make all car parks install CCTV. Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking / Vapouring outside train station or Near Bus stop
attributes.background: During winter tobacco smoking / Vapouring outside Train station and Bus stop is more to keep them warm. We are becoming Passive smokers including Kids.During peak hours it is smoky.

attributes.action: Protect victims of domestic violence who come from the European Union
attributes.background: To date, UK immigration legislation offers protection for victims of domestic violence who hold a non-European passport. There are no easements for victims who hold a European passport, if the perpetrator was British. I believe this is in breach of art 14 ECHR, freedom from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA citizens who are victims of domestic violence can apply for indefinite leave to remain by virtue of having been a victim of domestic violence, regardless of employment status in the UK.
 
These rights do not apply to EEA nationals.  They can only qualify for settled status if they are workers, or family members of a foreign worker. This does not protect victims adequately, especially if they have been prevented from working due to coercive and controlling behaviour.

attributes.action: Fund Carbon removal factories CDC & DAC in the UK powered by renewable energy.
attributes.background: Carbon pollution is acidifying our oceans, killing our wildlife and destroying our planet. This is unacceptable considering technology already exists that can extract Carbon from the atmosphere. Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC) and Direct Air Capture (DAC) can catch 1 million tons of CO2 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Right now there is technology known as "Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC)" and "Direct Air Capture (DAC)" that can remove carbon from our atmosphere. If this technology was rolled out on a national scale it will save lives, it will improve our Air. Powered by Renewable energies evidence suggests this tech could capture 1 million tons of CO2 Per Year. Recent studies show 1 in 6 deaths are linked to all forms of pollution in the UK. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Increase funding to the South Tees Hospitals Foundation Trust
attributes.background: The South Tees Foundation Trust, which operate the James Cook University Hospital in Middlesbrough and the Friarage Hospital in Northallerton are cutting back many services because they don’t have enough money, making the Friarage Hospital in Northallerton vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details: Northallerton as a town is growing and the South Tees NHS Foundation Trust is making more cuts and making the local community fearful of the future of the Friarage Hospital. Already we have lost Mental Health, Maternity, Children’s Services and now we are set to lose A&E and Intensive Care. As a hospital which serves the largest garrison in Europe at Catterick and the rural farming community we simply cannot afford to lose this hospital and its vital services

attributes.action: Make identity theft a punishable crime
attributes.background: A fraudster entered into a loan agreement in my name, but I could not record it as a crime. Technically loan companies, banks and so on are the victims of such crimes.
attributes.additional_details: Identity theft should be a separate offence with the person whose identity is stolen identified as the victim and the identity thief punished.

attributes.action: Make companies who have joint bills chase both parties for the debt
attributes.background: A lot of newly single mothers or fathers, who may have been subject to controlling behaviour, are left with bills that were half theirs but whilst paying them are not receiving help from the other payer. It should be made law that companies bill both payers so that the system is fairer.
attributes.additional_details: Severn Trent, Council Tax etc are all bills that will chase the home occupier for a full balance. However if an account has been in two peoples names previously it isn’t possible to split the bill and chase the other person. This is leaving many single parents with huge debt that they struggle to pay. Universal credit will split an advance repayment if there is a break of parties as should all other companies to make the system fairer. Particularly for victims of gambling, control and abuse.

attributes.action: Publish any research or advice on whether the referendum result is sound.
attributes.background: Campaigners have received fines, and petitions have asked for their transgressions to be taken into account when interpreting the referendum result. The Government must publish all documents taken into account when concluding that the referendum result is sound or state if no such evidence exists.
attributes.additional_details:
Democracy requires the government to take into account whether the result could have been affected, but that possibility has been repeatedly dismissed by the government.

Evidence to the contrary is available:
 - The Vote Leave director says they would not have won without the misleading £350m claim;
- Evidence given at the High Court stated that it is "very likely" that Vote Leave's overspending swung the result.

attributes.action: Free menstrual cup given to all 11 year old girls to eliminate period poverty.
attributes.background: Period poverty can be stamped out and our government can do a lot more about it. Free menstral cups and education in how to use them should be given to 11 year old girls when they start secondary school. Half of all school girls needlessly miss at least one full day of school due to their period.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 girls aged 14 to 21 can’t afford menstrual products. 
A menstrual cup can last for up to 10 years.
Many women have been forced to use improvised alternatives such as socks and toilet roll.
An average cost of a period in the UK is £128 in a year. This would be a saving of £1,280 over 10 years.
Young women shouldn’t have their education needlessly compromised.
Use of menstrual cups will reduce non degradable sanitary products being sent to landfill and polluting our environment.

attributes.action: Charge supermarkets 1p for every item sold in non recyclable plastic
attributes.background: Most of us recycle every item we can. I am frustrated with trying to buy food without plastic packaging. They charge 5p for a plastic carrier, introduce a national compulsory charge for supermarkets of 1p per plastic wrapped item. They will develop alternatives which will help reduce plastic waste.

attributes.action: The Armenian Genocide should be recognised by UK Parliament - 1.5 million died!
attributes.background: The House of Commons still doesn't recognise the Armenian Genocide in which 1.5m Armenians were systematically exterminated by the Ottoman Caliphate during WWI.
attributes.additional_details:
Armenian Genocide avoidance remains semi-official policy to appease Turkey.
 
The House of Commons has recognised other events as genocide. Yet the UK refuses to join the 29 countries, which label the killing of 1.5 million Armenians as 'genocide' - bearing in mind they were an ethnic and religious minority in the Ottoman Empire. 
 
The motives for this inconsistency can be left for you to decide.
 
Please sign and share this petition.

attributes.action: Online retail companies should pay an equivalent to UK high street rates.
attributes.background:
The High Street is suffering, losing thousands of jobs because online suppliers offer low paid jobs in distribution centres that pay minimal local business rates.
 
Many pay low corporation tax and again gain an unfair advantage over British and other tax paying businesses
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2018/aug/02/amazon-halved-uk-corporation-tax-bill-to-45m-last-year
 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-45053528
 
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/amazon-now-pay-even-less-13023482
 
https://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/998509/amazon-uk-tax-high-street-shops-business-tax-income-tax-taxation-system
 
https://www.ft.com/content/8fcf026e-38e0-11e8-8b98-2f31af407cc8

attributes.action: Hold banks properly to account over negligent handling of bank card fraud claims
attributes.background:
Banks are currently allowed to deny card fraud claims without providing evidence for their decision to customers.

They are not protecting our money and personal data from card fraud. At a time when large companies suffer mass data breaches this is not acceptable behaviour and should be penalised.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks avoid reimbursing the value of stolen funds, or compensating victims of bank fraud, not least because the Police, Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and Financial Ombudsman Service (FOS) are under-resourced and unable to cope with a growing epidemic of digital crime.

Government should:

- ask the FCA to conduct an investigation into this issue;
- amend the law to allow the FCA or FOS to issue fines in individual cases; and
- better resource the Ombudsman to conduct further investigations.

attributes.action: Make it law for alcohol producers to put all ingredients used on packaging
attributes.background: A lot of alcohol contains hidden ingredients people wouldn't think of: such as lactose and isinglass. These ingredients/processing methods may go against peoples' religious beliefs or they may be allergic to these ingredients.
attributes.additional_details: Often when emailing companies to enquire about the brewing/fermenting process or even just ingredients they will not give you a straight answer, or will tell you something whilst telling other people conflicting information. To avoid this I believe it would be simpler for companies to put ingredients and manufacturing methods on packaging or have the information freely available on websites. This would avoid any health complications due to hidden ingredients/manufacturing processes.

attributes.action: Give an mandatory prison sentence after a death due to physical assault
attributes.background: My father was killed by a punch to the head in 2004 and has never received justice, the man who killed him received only community service as he done a plea bargain and admitted culpable homicide. If you hit someone and kill them it should be a mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.additional_details: No one should be able to enter a plea bargain if they hit someone and the person dies as a result. We all know right from wrong and if you kill someone then justice should serve an instant prison sentence whatever your intentions. We lost my father in 2004 and all the accused got was community service. Where's the justice in that? What does that mean for my poor father who dies of a single punch to the head? He ended up brain dead because of his injury. Help me to stop this.

attributes.action: workers on benefits should be able to do overtime when needed without deductions
attributes.background: Workers who claim benefits should be able to do overtime e.g. 20 hours, when needed, over a tax year to help in times of hardship. After the capped overtime hours have been used you cannot do anymore in that year.
attributes.additional_details: This proposal came about after I wanted to consider overtime to help me and my son, but I am unable to do so.

attributes.action: Routinely arm all UK Police Officers.
attributes.background:
The British Police face numerous threats including terrorists, robbers, drug dealers, in addition to the growing numbers teenagers who now regularly carry knives.

These individuals have no fear, do not value life and would not think twice about shooting or stabbing an unarmed Police Officer.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclists must wear crash helmets
attributes.background: Make it law that all cyclists must wear protective headwear when out on the road.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015 - the last year for which statistics relating to accidents caused by cyclists are available - two pedestrians were killed and 96 seriously injured after being hit by a bicycle. But every year more than 100 cyclists are killed and more than 3,000 seriously injured on British roads – the majority by motorists.

attributes.action: Stop charging students council tax on property rented for graduating year
attributes.background: Students are exempt from paying council tax however if a student is still living in student accommodation after they’ve graduated, they’re expected to pay the remaining months, even though their finically situation is still the same or most of the time, even worse.
attributes.additional_details: Contracts are only available for 12 months from most letting agents therefor trapping students into a fee that most of them can’t afford or have to pay with their student loan which is supposed to be used to help forward they’re education and living costs. We still have to pay this loan back and being forced to give a large amount of it away for a period of time in which you can’t control is very worrying. The exemption of students paying council tax should last their whole tenancy agreement.

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.

attributes.action: Enforce plastic bottle companies to use PLASTIC KILLS templates to reduce litter
attributes.background: This petition is proposing single-use plastic bottle companies to be legally required to use a graphical template to encourage recycling and use of more sustainable products. Graphics will be similar to the "Smoking Kills" campaign, except it will associate single-use plastic with ocean pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Overall just 32% of plastic is recycled and 70% recovered (BFP, 2017); our most sustainable option is to therefore not use it considering only a small portion is recycled. 

By associating images of marine life affected by plastic in a "SINGLE-USE PLASTIC KILLS" graphic template, this will raise awareness that plastic affects the natural world negatively. The aim is to change consumer habits into making more responsible choices e.g. using reusable water bottles & recycling single-use bottles.

attributes.action: Ban homework for primary school children.
attributes.background: Let children be children. Young children should not be set homework. It is wrong. They have no time to enjoy being a child due to the pressure schools give to them. I want the government to ban homework for all primary school children. Instead they can need guided learning where they can explore.

attributes.action: Increase funding and resources to find a cure for type 1 diabetes.
attributes.background: I've been diabetic for 6 years and don't understand why type 1 diabetes hasn't been noticed as a major problem. We need increased funding from the government and increased resources such as equipment scientists etc. And have it been taken more seriously because it ruins lives having to inject.
attributes.additional_details: Diabetes has been proven to increase chances of heart diseases and decreased life expectancy to 66 years old it's a horrible disease and needs more funding and resources to help with a cure for the young people and adults suffering with it.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to show all materials used in clothing and footwear.
attributes.background:
At present some clothing and footwear is insufficiently labelled. All materials used should be clearly labelled for consumers.

Individuals may not wish to wear products that contain leather from animals or particular animals such as pigs in accordance with their values or beliefs.

attributes.action: Establish a Parliamentary Proxy Voting Procedure
attributes.background: An MP was forced to delay a caesarean section to deliver her baby in order to be in Parliament on 15 January 2019 to vote on the Government's plan to leave the EU.  We urge parliament to establish a proxy voting procedure for MPs who require parental, medical or bereavement leave.
attributes.additional_details: The only option for MPs who cannot be present in Parliament is to be paired with one from the other side of an issue who agrees not to vote.  The pairing system is informal, and was shown to be ineffective last July when MP Brandon Lewis broke a pairing arrangement with MP Jo Swinson, who was on maternity leave.  Our elected representatives must be allowed to represent us without having to compromise their children's health and well-being, their own health, or their families' urgent needs.

attributes.action: Over turn the proposed ban on log burners and open fires
attributes.background:
How will the government's anti-pollution strategy affect you?
Heavily-polluting log burners and open-fire fuels will be banned

Please sign the petition to over try and over turn this ban
attributes.additional_details:
Many people depend on their wood burners and open fires as their main source of heat. Frankly life would not be worth living in the winter months without a real fire. Many elderly people use open fires, this is their only form of heat.
Burning wood is a natural process whereas burning fossil fuels is an unnatural process. Without burning wood the only source of heat will be through oil, gas or electricity all of which produce pollutions in their own form far more serious than burning wood.

attributes.action: Increase funding for suicide research & offer specialist support to stop it.
attributes.background: As a mother raising children in the UK, I have a burning desire to find out why suicide is on the increase, especially amongst the male age group 18 - 49, support needs to be given to stop it & assistance mechanisms should be put in place to stop these unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Suicide can happen to any family at anytime & it leaves them devastated. We need to reach out to those who are susceptible and ensure that they are able to get any assistance they need before they make the difficult choice to take their own life. It is a silent killer and more most be done so that individuals considering it are able to open up and discuss their problems rather than feel that suicide is the only option.

attributes.action: Require every vehicle manufactured to have their lights constantly on
attributes.background: Daytime running lights also known as (Drls) are dangerous, travelling around the country I’ve seen far too many people driving at nighttime with only the vehicle drls on, which unfortunately are only on the front of vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: As a professional driver (hgv) I believe drls are very dangerous and all motor vehicles manufactured should now constantly have their lights on, best example car is the Volvo, if the switch is positioned on (0) then the headlights are still on! Several times I have been close to a collision due to this and personally I don’t think it would be fair for anyone to have an accident and potentially injure or even kill a person or family and get punished for it for the sake of making it a legal requirement that vehicle lights are constantly on.

attributes.action: Abolish Ban on Entertainment Shows using House of Commons Footage.
attributes.background:
'no extracts of Parliamentary proceedings may be used in any light entertainment programme or in a programme of political satire'
 
This is a rule of coverage for Parliamentary footage that has existed since 1989. It is an infringement on both freedom of speech and press.
attributes.additional_details:
https://publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm200203/cmselect/cmbroad/786/786.pdf -Page 22
 
With the globalisation of media through the internet and social media, it is now foolish to assume that the electorate will be 'protected' from seeing satirical footage of Parliament.
 
Without a constitution, we MUST uphold individual freedoms in statute law. This can only be done by ridding of this futile and ineffective regulation.

attributes.action: Homeoffice should not over charge health surcharge from UK Visa Applicants
attributes.background: UK Suppose Visa is issued for 33 Months however applicants are being charged for three Full years.
attributes.additional_details:
As per GOV.UK health surcharge for Visa Applicants is £200 per year at the moment as it going to be increased.
Why there is full 1 health surcharge where Visa is being issued for less than a year.
For example suppose Visa is issued for 33 months but Applicants have to pay health surcharge full £600 which is for 3 full years.

attributes.action: The UK should agree to the UN's Global Compact for Migration
attributes.background: The Global Compact seeks to safeguard the rights of migrants and reduce the negative effects of sudden high levels of migration, partially by reducing the structural problems in countries that cause irregular migration.  The Compact is simply a framework for co operation and not legally binding.
attributes.additional_details:
Global Compact pdf - https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/sites/default/files/180713_agreed_outcome_global_compact_for_migration.pdf

UN brief description of Compact's aims: https://refugeesmigrants.un.org/migration-compact

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Reopen the Exeter to Plymouth Railway line via Okehampton
attributes.background:
Exeter to Plymouth has currently one railway line connecting two big cities. The current railway line in bad weather is always being closed to trains. This cuts off Plymouth and Cornwall from the rest of the country.
Reopening the Okehampton route will help the situation.

attributes.action: Initiate a Royal Commission examining Policing in the UK
attributes.background: Policing in the UK appears to be at crisis point- the last Royal Commision on Policing was held in 1962, over half a century ago. The policing landscape has significantly evolved in 56 years, and a review of policing practice in the UK is long overdue.

attributes.action: Stop insurers charging interest on monthly payments for motor premiums.
attributes.background: When taking out a motor insurance policy, you either pay for their premiums annually or monthly. However, often, monthly premiums attract high interest rates, making insurance more expensive. This is penalising low income families who can't afford to pay annually.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Traffic Act 1930 made it a legal requirement to hold a valid motor insurance policy if you drive a car on the public highway with at least third party cover. However, many on lower incomes, who rely on their car, have no choice but to pay monthly and therefore penalised with interest loaded on. The law should be changed so they cannot add interest. 

Insurers say it costs to process monthly payments, but considering Direct Line Group, for example, made a £293.8m pre-tax profit in the first half of 2018 (https://www.directlinegroup.com/~/media/Files/D/Direct-Line-Group-V2/reports-and-presentations/h1-results-2018-annoucement.pdf), it's unfair.

attributes.action: Stop insurance discrimination affecting those with pre existing medical issues
attributes.background: Our society (rightly) talks about equality and yet the Government accepts insurance companies charging people more money for taking out policies - if they have a pre existing medical condition. It's blatant prejudice and discrimination. The government must stop this insurance industry-led practice.
attributes.additional_details: The Government has said (in a letter to MP David Davies) that this is a commercial matter. Yet human rights are not a commercial matter. Life & CIC insurance is necessary for security. The Universal Declaration of Human Rights says: Article 25. (1) Everyone has the right to security in the event of unemployment, sickness, disability... in circumstances beyond his control. 'Everyone' includes people with pre existing medical conditions who cannot afford higher premiums for life/CIC insurance.

attributes.action: Require fathers who pay child support to be named on the birth certificate.
attributes.background: It seems today we have a very unfair systems in which a resident parent can prevent a non-resident parent from having any rights, prevent visitation and still claim money.
attributes.additional_details:
If a mother knows who the father is, it should be a requirement that they are named on the birth certificate, before any claims for child support can be made. 
Today we talk about how everyone should be treated equally, yet it seems unless you're the father of child out of wedlock. It equality of parents has been forgotten.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of early cancer symptoms among GPs
attributes.background: After recent family dealings with cancer and previous friends I have known dying from cancer it was evident that the GP's involved were at a loss to diagnose what was happening which may have contributed to the disease not being treated early enough resulting in prolonged suffering.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should provide more training on the symptoms and tests that can spot cancer early.

attributes.action: Criminal Record checks on drivers of taxis and private hire a legal requirement.
attributes.background: Currently no legal requirement only recommendations. There should be mandatory checks in place as a minimum requirement. Licences should be removed from those found to have violent or sexual convictions. We have a duty to protect women, children and the vulnerable and less able.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers of taxis and private hire vehicles are currently allowed to keep their licences and continue to work even if they have criminal convictions.

attributes.action: Ban tenancies that require rent paid in advance for social housing
attributes.background: Becuase im on universal credit I have to pay £20 pound on top of my rent. Because my rent is meant to be paid in advance but the housing element is paid in arreas, and if I dont pay this I will be breaching my tenacy agreement, I want social housing to be banned from making tenancies like this.
attributes.additional_details: Or if they cant stop making tenancies like this make universal credit housing element paid weekly.
